Uses of Class
oracle.kubernetes.operator.work.Step

  • Packages that use Step 
    Package Description
    oracle.kubernetes.operator
    The main classes for the Oracle WebLogic Server Kubernetes Operator.
    oracle.kubernetes.operator.calls  
    oracle.kubernetes.operator.helpers
    Helper classes that provide easy access to various Kubernetes features.
    oracle.kubernetes.operator.http
    An HTTP client that is used when making REST calls to WebLogic Administration Servers.
    oracle.kubernetes.operator.steps  
    oracle.kubernetes.operator.wlsconfig
    Classes used to retrieve configuration of a WebLogic Domain or health from individual servers.
    oracle.kubernetes.operator.work
    User-level thread infrastructure for the Operator.

    • Uses of Step in oracle.kubernetes.operator.calls

      Subclasses of Step in oracle.kubernetes.operator.calls 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  AsyncRequestStep<T>
      A Step driven by an asynchronous call to the Kubernetes API, which results in a series of callbacks until canceled.
      Methods in oracle.kubernetes.operator.calls with parameters of type Step 
      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void NextAction.delay​(Step next, Packet p, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Indicates that the fiber should be suspended for the indicated delay duration and then automatically resumed.
      void NextAction.invoke​(Step next, Packet p)
      Indicates that the next action should be to invoke the next step's apply(Packet).

      Sets the next step

      Starts the execution of this fiber asynchronously.

      Starts Fiber that cancels any earlier running Fibers with the same key.
      Fiber FiberGate.startFiberIfLastFiberMatches​(java.lang.String key, Fiber old, Step strategy, Packet packet, Fiber.CompletionCallback callback)
      Starts Fiber only if the last started Fiber matches the given old Fiber.

      Starts Fiber only if there is no running Fiber with the same key.
      void NextAction.suspend​(Step next, java.util.function.Consumer<Fiber> onExit)
      Indicates that the fiber should be suspended.
